awards.description: THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO TRADITIONAL VILLAGE OF TOGIAK TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL BUILD ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY TO DEVELOP AND MANAGE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM, ADDRESS THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS OF SOLID WASTE, NETWORK WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON ALASKA SALMON PROGRAM.

DESCRIPTION:ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM OFFICE (EPO) WILL BUILD TRIBAL CAPACITY TO DEVELOP AND MANAGE A TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM. EPO WILL ADDRESS THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS OF SOLID WASTE. EPO WILL DEVELOP A BASIC UNDERSTANDING OF CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS, CONDITIONS IMPORTANT TO MONITOR AND ELEMENTS TO INCLUDED IN CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTATION PLAN.ACTIVITIES:TOGIAK ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM OFFICE WILL IMPLEMENT GAP GRANT WORKPLAN AND APPLY FOR OTHER GRANTS. ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM WILL WORK TO DECREASE THE AMOUNT OF LITTER IN COMMUNITY AND KEEP RECYCLABLES OUT OF LANDFILL. ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE WITH SHORELINE MONITORING DATA COLLECTION PROJECT WITH COMMUNITY AND MONITOR RATE OF EROSION OCCURRING.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM STAFF WILL INCREASE CAPACITY TO MANAGE THE TRADITIONAL COUNCIL OF TOGIAK'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM. ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM STAFF WILL DECREASE AMOUNT OF SOLID WASTE AND HAZARDOUS WASTE CONTAMINANTS TO TOGIAK TRIBE'S LAND, WATER AND HUMAN HEALTH. ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM STAFF WILL DEVELOP ADAPTATION STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS ON INFRASTRUCTURE, FOOD SECURITY AND PUBLIC HEALTH FOR THE TOGIAK TRIBE. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS THE COMMUNITY OF TOGIAK.
TOGIAK A19AV00924 ADD FY 2019 ROAD MAINTENANCE
TRADITIONAL VILLAGE OF TOGIAK ROAD MAINTENANCE
